rsbNotes.title: Pr 26:13–16
rsbNotes.text: 26:13–16 Four proverbs reflect on laziness that works against well-ordered human existence and against life itself. See 6:6–11; 24:30–34 and notes.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 26:13
rsbNotes.text: 26:13 See 22:13 and note.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 26:14
rsbNotes.text: 26:14 Just like a door on its hinges, so lazy persons turn restlessly on their beds.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 26:16
rsbNotes.text: 26:16 seven men. The precise number, although often symbolizing completeness, is not important in this instance; it serves only to highlight the self-delusion of the fool.
